channel.title: mycatalog updates
channel.description: 'My Catalog' uses the IBM Cloud catalog API to retrieve data from the catalog. It attempts to be as accurate as possible. This feed shows additions, updates, removals from the catalog. Use with care. It is a work-in-progress :)

item.title: [added] Enterprise Application Service (enterprise-app-java)
item.description: IBM Enterprise Application Service for Java is an end-to-end solution to building and running secure Jakarta EE/MicroProfile applications running efficiently in Liberty deployed on public clouds.

item.title: [updated] Db2 (dashdb-for-transactions) has a new plan named db2-subscription
item.description:
Base configuration starts with 4 vCPUs, 16 GB of RAM, 400 IOPS and 50GB of storage.
The starting configuration provides one SQL database per service instance residing on dedicated VPC machines. Scale your database up to 128 vCPUs (1024 GB of memory) and 40 TB of storage for data and logs. Gen 3 offers a high availability option that includes one database running on two dedicated virtual servers. The high availability instances are provisioned across multiple availability zones. Scale your compute, storage and IOPS independently to achieve the perfect price/performance fit.
A pre-paid monthly subscription plan for customers who have made a purchase through an IBM Sales representative. Usage above the contract entitlement will incur overage charges.

item.title: [updated] Db2 (dashdb-for-transactions) has a new plan named performance
item.description:
Base configuration starts with 4 vCPUs, 16 GB of RAM, 400 IOPS and 50GB of storage.
The starting configuration provides one SQL database per service instance residing on dedicated VPC machines. Scale your database up to 128 vCPUs (1024 GB of memory) and 40 TB of storage for data and logs. Gen 3 offers a high availability option that includes one database running on two dedicated virtual servers. The high availability instances are provisioned across multiple availability zones. Scale your compute, storage and IOPS independently to achieve the perfect price/performance fit.
The service is billed hourly based on the number of resource units. Monthly resource units are shown for machine types during selection. Storage requires 0.0125 RU per 20 GB/month and 0.0375 RU per 100 IOPS/month. Backups require 0.3125 RU per TB/month.
